content.text: Hi, I want to source an item. Candle making material - molds wicks colours fragrances waxes jars

content.thinking: Candle making supplies - multiple items. Show expertise, give value first.

content.text:
Great choice ‚Äî candle making supplies are one of the more popular sourcing categories from China. Here's a quick overview:

- *Silicone molds:* $0.50-3/pc depending on size and detail
- *Cotton wicks:* $0.01-0.05/pc (pre-tabbed costs a bit more)
- *Dye chips/liquid colorants:* $1-4/kg
- *Fragrance oils:* $3-8/kg (depends on scent complexity)
- *Soy/paraffin wax:* $1-3/kg
- *Glass jars with lids:* $0.30-2/pc depending on size and finish

Roughly how many units are you looking at ‚Äî are you starting a candle brand or restocking an existing operation?
Brother i m new beginner and student. May i cannot purchase in bulk but 25 to 35 wicks some candle jars like 10 to 15 different molds. Candle fragrances of approx 20 to 30 ml

Appreciate the honesty, brother! Since you're just starting out with small quantities like that, international sourcing from China won't make sense for you ‚Äî the shipping cost alone would be more than the products themselves.

For these quantities, you'd get *much better prices* from:

- *Local craft suppliers* in your area
- *Amazon or Etsy* for starter kits
- *AliExpress or 1688* where you can buy small quantities directly

When you scale up to *100+ jars, 500+ wicks, bulk wax by the carton* ‚Äî that's where we really shine and save you serious money. Come back anytime when you're ready to go bigger! ü§ù
